solution.text:
Refill interval of 1st generator = _{{(pow(2,i))*(pow(5,j))*(pow(3,(k+2)))}}_ hours
And,
Refill interval of 2nd generator = _{{(pow(2,(i+2)))*(pow(3,k))*(pow(5,(j+1)))}}_ hours
To find out the number of hours after which both generators will be refilled together.We need to find the LCM of time interval of both generator.
So, first factorizing both numbers as follows:
1st generator = \(2^{_{i}_}\times 5^{_{j}_}\times 3^{_{{k+2}}_}\)
2nd generator = \(2^{_{{i+2}}_}\times 3^{_{k}_}\times 5^{_{{j+1}}_}\)
Therefore,
LCM = \(2^{_{{i+2}}_}\times 3^{_{{k+2}}_}\times 5^{_{{j+1}}_}\)
LCM = _{{(pow(2,(i+2)))*(pow(3,(k+2)))*(pow(5,(j+1)))}}_
Hence employee will have to refill both the generators together, after _{{(pow(2,(i+2)))*(pow(3,(k+2)))*(pow(5,(j+1)))}}_ hours

content.text: An employee has to refill two generators after regular interval of time.For the first generator he needs to refill it after every _{{(pow(2,i))*(pow(5,j))*(pow(3,(k+1)))}}_ hours and for the other generator refill time interval is _{{(pow(2,(i+2)))*(pow(3,k))*(pow(5,(j+1)))}}_ hours. If initially both the generators were started together, find the time period after which employee will have to refill both the generators together.
